summary: Terrorists and criminals can target the U.S. supply chain through security vulnerabilities in foreign ports. The Coast Guard's International Port Security Program aims to assess and strengthen the security of these ports. We reviewed the program, which resumed full operations in May 2021 after being impacted by the pandemic. We found that the Coast Guard could: More consistently assess security in countries that don't allow...
title: Coast Guard: Opportunities Exist to Strengthen Foreign Port Security Assessment Program
